pwd)JOB_DATA_PATH=${JOB_HOME}/dataPROCESSED_FILE_PATH=${JOB_HOME}/proSECRETS_CONF_PATH=${JOB_HOME}/confmkdir -p ${JOB_HOME}/{data,pro,conf}# HDFSHADOOP_HOME=/home/${USER}/software/hadoopHDFS_PATH=/hdfs/*/some_log/#---------------------------# å‡½æ•°å:genTargetFileModel# åŠŸèƒ½:ç”Ÿæˆç›®æ ‡æ–‡ä»¶æ¨¡å¼,éå†HDFSç›®å½•ï¼Œç”Ÿæˆæ—¥ã€æ—¶ã€åˆ†# å‚æ•°: $1 æ—¥æœŸï¼Œæ ¼å¼ yyyy-MM-dd# è¿”å›:æ— #---------------------------function genTargetFileModel() { # éå†æ—¥æœŸ ETL_DT=$1 CUR_HDFS_PATH=`echo ${HDFS_PATH}|sed "s:*:${ETL_DT}:"` for (( i = 0; i < 24; i++ )); do for (( j = 0; j < 12; j++ )); do hour=`printf "%02d" $i` minutes=$((j*5)) minutes=`printf "%02d" $minutes` mkdir -p ${JOB_DATA_PATH}/${ETL_DT}/${hour}/${minutes} done done for path in `${HADOOP_HOME}/bin/hadoop fs -ls ${CUR_HDFS_PATH} \ |awk '{print $8}'`;do echo "${ETL_DT}:${path}" >> ${PROCESSED_FILE_PATH}/pro_${ETL_DT}.txt ${HADOOP_HOME}/bin/hadoop fs -text ${path} |awk '{ split($0,a," "); datestr=substr(a[1],11,10); hourstr=substr(a[2],1,2); minutestr=substr(a[2],4,2); minutestr=int(minutestr/5)*5; if(minutestr<10){ minutestr=("0"minutestr) } gsub("\"","",a[3]) split(a[3],b,","); gsub("{|}","",b[3]) gsub("fields:HOSTNAME:","",b[3]) gsub("\\\\t","\t",b[1]) gsub(";","\t",b[1]) lens=split(b[1],tA,"\t") if(lens==12){ re=(b[1]"\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t"b[3]) } if(lens==15){ re=(b[1]"\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t"b[3]) } path=(datestr"/"hourstr"/"minutestr"/log_"datestr"_"hourstr"_"minutestr".txt") print re >> path }' done unset ETL_DT}#---------------------------# å‡½æ•°å:genTargetFileModel# åŠŸèƒ½:ç”Ÿæˆç›®æ ‡æ–‡ä»¶æ¨¡å¼,éå†HDFSç›®å½•ï¼Œç”Ÿæˆæ—¥ã€æ—¶ã€åˆ†# å‚æ•°: $1 æ—¥æœŸï¼Œæ ¼å¼ yyyy-MM-dd# è¿”å›:æ— #---------------------------function sendByRysnc() { ETL_DT=$1 nohup /usr/bin/rsync -avz \ --bwlimit=30720 \ --port=873 \ --progress \ --password-file=${SECRETS_CONF_PATH}/secret.conf ${JOB_DATA_PATH}/${ETL_DT} ${user}@${ip}::${module}/${path}/ >> rysnc_send_$(date +%Y%m%d).log 2>&1 & unset ETL_DT}function mainStart() { ETL_DT=$1 genTargetFileModel ${ETL_DT} sendByRysnc ${ETL_DT}}mainStart 2017-09-29

Did you remember to kinit for UID %d?\n", kpath, ctx->uid); ret = -EACCES; goto error; }// æŸ¥æ‰¾kerberosè®¤è¯åçš„cacheæ–‡ä»¶ï¼Œä»å‘ç°cacheæ–‡ä»¶ä½äºï¼š/tmp/krb5cc_%d/** * Find the Kerberos ticket cache path. * * This function finds the Kerberos ticket cache path from the thread ID and * user ID of the process making the request. * * Normally, the ticket cache path is in a well-known location in /tmp. * However, it's possible that the calling process could set the KRB5CCNAME * environment variable, indicating that its Kerberos ticket cache is at a * non-default location. We try to handle this possibility by reading the * process' environment here.
